page.title: 08HOUSING IN SUTTON ST JAMES
page.content: We are in the open countryside so we have no tower blocks, large hotels, or any flats at all. Most houses or bungalows are detached, and stand on their own piece of land, with no very near neighbours.In the village itself are some semi _ detached houses,but almost all of these have large gardens. A large number of people keep hens. All houses and bungalows are of red brick and tile apart from a very few timber bungalows.A fair number of properties have an Agricultural Habitation Clause on them,which means you have to be employed on the land to live in them.There is no mains drainage,so everyone has a septic tank in the garden.Some houses have solid fuel or oil-fired central heating.There is no gas.Sometimes,after a dry summer, houses may subside.
